page.title: 01GOXHILL & ITS ENVIRONS.
page.content: Goxhill is 2 km south of the Humber estuary opposite Hull where the river bends towards the sea. The landscape is flat. The village is isolated as only two roads lead from it to neighbouring villages. Goxhill is an elongated village - North and South Ends, as they are known, being over 2km apart. New housing has been developed on a small scale at both extremities of the village and there has been some infilling. In recent years the population has grown with many people employed in the fertilizer and petro-chemical industies on the Humber Bank. Families from north of the river have moved to Goxhill as the opening of the Humber Bridge, in 1981, made access easier to Hull. Goxhill's cheaper property and pleasant environment is also an attraction. {Population in 1983 - 1560.}
